title: Former Bill Clinton adviser: Hillary feels ‘God put her on Earth’ to be president, but one thing is keeping her from running
text:
‘She feels entitled to do it. She feels compelled to do it. She feels that God put her on the Earth to do it.’ Dick Morris

That’s Dick Morris, former adviser to President Bill Clinton, talking on John Catsimatidis’s radio show about why he believes there might only be one thing standing in the way of former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton entering the 2020 presidential race.

“My feeling is that she wants to,” Morris said. “But she’s hesitant because she realizes the timing is bad. She’s got to wait until Biden drops out because he’s obviously next in line for it, and if he goes away, there’s an opening for her.”

Hillary recently brought up the notion in an interview:

#NEW: Hillary Clinton jokes about running for president again after Pres. Trump suggested on Twitter that she enter the race: “Obviously I can beat him again.” pic.twitter.com/Gywt0XAQDq — Jennifer Franco (@jennfranconews) October 9, 2019

Morris, who resigned as Bill Clinton’s adviser in 1996 after a tabloid reported that he had a relationship with a call girl, explained that Hillary would take former Vice President Joe Biden’s spot as the moderate candidate for those looking for an alternative to “leftist” Elizabeth Warren. “Make no mistake. She wants it,” he added. “She’s planning on it. She’ll do everything she can to achieve it.”

Listen to the interview:

CATS Roundtable Local Edition #podcast

Sunday, Oct 27th ► Interview with @DickMorrisTweet - Will Hillary run in 2020? Tan rested and ready.https://t.co/vTgGJzggNp — John Catsimatidis (@JCats2013) October 27, 2019

Clearly, oddsmakers don’t think Clinton making a run at the White House is all that farfetched. Here’s the latest from Bovada, which shows Clinton, at 13-to1, trailing Pete Buttigieg but ahead of Andrew Yang. Warren is the clear favorite, even as national polls put Biden in the lead.
description: Dick Morris went on the John Catsimatidis’s radio show to talk about the likelihood of Hillary Clinton running for president.
